title: Marina Ivanova
text:
Twitter

     Google Scholar
  

  
  
I have successfully completed my PhD in English Linguistics from the Chemnitz University of Technology. I am interested in the fields of psycholinguistics, phonology, second language acquisition, and corpus linguistics.


Email: marina.ivanova[at]phil.tu-chemnitz.de



My PhD thesis on the perception and production of word stress cues in Slavic English varieties is now online.

title: Marina Ivanova
text: Email: marina.ivanova[at]phil.tu-chemnitz.de

title: Publications
text:
Ivanova, M., Neubert, C. R., Schmied, J., & Bendixen, A. (2023). ERP evidence for Slavic and German word stress cue sensitivity in English. Frontiers in Psychology 14. doi: 10.3389/fpsyg.2023.1193822 (Preprint PsyArXiv doi: 10.31234/osf.io/hqr34)
Ivanova, M. & Schmied, J. (2023). From cues to features: Bridging psycho- and sociolinguistics in the development of non-native English stimuli. TESOL Communications 2(2), 1-17. doi: 10.58304/tc.20230201
Ivanova, M. (accepted). German English-medium linguistics journal abstracts over the last 30 years: Quantitative and qualitative structural developments. TOKEN: A Journal of English Linguistics.
Schmied, J., & Ivanova, M. (accepted). English MA Theses at a German University before and after the Bologna reform: Comparing global rhetorical structures and stance in Linguistics and Cultural Studies. TOKEN: A Journal of English Linguistics.
Ivanova, M. (accepted). Training word stress perception and production with technology. The EUROCALL Review.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Scientific assistant 2019 - 2022 English Language and Linguistics, TU Chemnitz - Coordinator of two DAAD projects with Southeast Europe - Statistical analysis, corpus preparation, annotation of sociolinguistic interviews, research and editing 
Internship Linguistics 03 - 05.2020 VICO Research and Consulting near Stuttgart - Modeling of search queries for social media monitoring on customer topics - Annotation of posts from the social web according to tonality 
Scientific assistant 2017 - 2019 English Literatures, TU Chemnitz

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Skills
Bulgarian (native), English (fluent), German (fluent) Statistical analysis - R, Matlab Phonetic analysis and resynthesis - Praat Transcription and annotation of audio data - Praat, ELAN, GAT Text analysis and annotation - AntConc, INCEpTION, Python Version control – Git

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Organisation
Organised workshops and summer schools in the frame of the DAAD projects “From Uncertainty to Confidence and Trust” (2020), “Constructing Confidence and Trust Online” (2021) and “Comparing Confidence and Trust Online and Offline” (2022).

title: Talks and Workshops
text:
15.07.23. Albrecht, S., Isiaka, A., Ivanova, M. “Igbo and Yoruba English vowel spaces compared”. Digital English World Wide in Chemnitz.

title: Talks and Workshops
text:
Workshops

28-30.03.2022. Online Workshop Hands-on formatting with MS Word and reference management with Zotero. TEFL-ePal Dissemination.
23.11.2021. “Hands-on Corpus Linguistics workshop. The Corona Corpus (Davies 2019-) and AntConc (Anthony 2020)”. Formatting workshop.
10.11.21. Hands-on introductory workshop with R. Faculty of Pedagogy, Masaryk University Brno.
12.10.21. “Interview preparation. Introduction to data processing with Praat (Boersma & Weenink 2021)” CASE PhD workshop.
15.12.20. “What the APA 7 teaches us outside citation and formatting.” Workshop at the online Chemnitz Africa/Asia Symposium on English (CASE).
27.10.20. “Smart online research and discourse annotation.” Workshop at the online Summer School From Uncertainty to Confidence and Trust.
25.08.19. “Beyond the 6 WH: Preparing, conducting and presenting impactful interviews.” Workshop at the Summer School Conflicting Truths in Academic and Journalistic Writing in Ohrid, N. Macedonia.
